title: nbdev-hello-world
text:
This file will become your README and also the index of your documentation.
If you are new to using nbdev here are some useful pointers to get you started.

title: nbdev-hello-world
text:
Usage

Installation
Install latest from the GitHub repository:
$ pip install git+https://github.com/magistak/nbdev-hello-world.git
or from conda
$ conda install -c magistak nbdev_hello_world
or from pypi
$ pip install nbdev_hello_world


Documentation
Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub repositoryâ€™s pages. Additionally you can find package manager specific guidelines on conda and pypi respectively.

title: nbdev-hello-world
text:
How to use

hello()

Hello world!



say_hello("Name")

'Hello Name!'

title: Hello world!
text:
source

hello

 hello ()

Say hello!

source


say_hello

 say_hello (to)

Say hello to somebody!

from fastcore.test import *


test_eq(say_hello("Hamel"), "Hello Hamel!")


from IPython.display import display,SVG


display(SVG('<svg height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><circle cx="50" cy="50" r="40"/></svg>'))
